intro: Helicteres plebeia, commonly known as the common helicteres, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by indehiscent capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
